oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Synthesis and fluorescence properties of covalently linked diphenyl ethyne bridged porphyrin trimers
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: RAVIKANTH, M
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: energy-transfer
systems
arrays
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The covalently linked diaryl ethyne bridged porphyrin trimers containing Zn(II) and free base porphyrin units have been synthesized and characterized. Ground state absorption spectra of trimers indicate a strong interaction between the porphyrin units. Steady state fluorescence measurements of hybrid porphyrin trimers suggest an efficient energy transfer from Zn(II) porphyrin unit to free base porphyrin unit.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: INDIAN JOURNAL OF CHEMISTRY SECTION A-INORGANIC BIO-INORGANIC PHYSICAL THEORETICAL & ANALYTICAL CHEMISTRY, 40(1), 86-89
